title: Sienna Miller enjoys dinner with Robert De Niro and Bruce Springsteen
text:
The trio went for a post-filming bite to eat (Picture: PA, Splash)

Sienna Miller headed out for dinner with some rather famous faces on Friday night as she was joined by legendary stars Bruce Springsteen and Robert De Niro.

The 37-year-old actress met Robert and Bruce while filming The Graham Norton Show earlier in the day, with the unlikely trio heading to seafood restaurant J Sheekey in Covent Garden together after hitting it off on the red sofa.

Now we only have one question: why didn’t fellow guest Paul Rudd get an invite?

Wearing ripped jeans and a chunky cardigan, Sienna opted for a casual look, which she accessorised with a yellow leather tote bag and shearling lined Gucci loafers.

Bruce, 70, opted for a similar off-duty outfit, looking typically cool in a blue and green plaid shirt with a leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Meanwhile, Robert, 76, went for a smarter look in grey trousers, a dark green shirt and a striped scarf.

We’re loving Sienna’s look (Picture: Palace Lee/Splash)

Coolest man in the world? Very possibly (Picture: Palace Lee/Splash)

Robert took Trump to task on the show (Picture: Palace Lee/Splash)

Appearing together on Graham Norton’s Friday night chat show (along with Paul), the actor took the opportunity to continue laying into US President Donald Trump.

The Joker star said: ‘Today we kind of have a weird twisted president who thinks he’s a gangster, who is not even a good gangster.’

We need to know what happened to Paul and James Blunt’s invites… (Picture: Isabel Infantes/PA)

‘This is a guy, even gangsters have honour among thieves, you shake a hand and you have your word, that’s all you have is your word,’ he said.

‘They have your word and that’s it, this guy is not the case.’

‘I didn’t even bring him up ladies and gentlemen,’ Graham joked back.

The Graham Norton Show airs Friday on BBC One at 10.35pm.
